SEARCH
Package entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
entities.Entity
entities.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Player extends Entity implements Runnable
The Player class represents the player entity in the game. It handles player movement, animations, health, and attacks.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class entities.Entity

    airSpeed, aniIndex, aniTick, attackBox, currentHealth, height, hitbox, inAir, maxHealth, state, walkSpeed, width, x, y

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(float x, float y, int width, int height, Playing playing)
      Constructs a new Player object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - The initial x-coordinate of the player.
      y - The initial y-coordinate of the player.
      width - The width of the player.
      height - The height of the player.
      playing - The current Playing game state.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the player's thread.

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the player thread, continuously updating the player state while the player is active. The thread sleeps for 16 milliseconds between updates. If the thread is interrupted, it will stop execution.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the player's thread.

    • setSpawn

      public void setSpawn(Point spawn)
      Sets the player's spawn point.
      Parameters:
      spawn - The spawn point coordinates.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the player's state and performs necessary actions such as updating health bar, checking for collision with spikes or potions, updating attack hitbox, updating position, and managing animations.

    • render

      public void render(Graphics g, int lvlOffset)
      Renders the player's graphics, including animations and UI elements.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object to render onto.
      lvlOffset - The offset of the level rendering.

    • changeHealth

      public void changeHealth(int value)
      Changes the player's health by a specified value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to change the health by.

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Sets the player's current health to 0, effectively killing the player. This method is typically called when the player's health reaches zero.

    • changePower

      public void changePower(int value)
      Changes the player's power by the specified value. This method currently prints a message to the console indicating that power has been added.
      Parameters:
      value - The value by which to change the player's power.

    • loadLvlData

      public void loadLvlData(int[][] lvlData)
      Loads level data for collision detection.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - The level data representing collision map. It is typically a 2D array of integers.

    • resetDirBooleans

      public void resetDirBooleans()
      Resets the directional boolean flags (left and right) to false. This method is typically called to reset movement direction after movement.

    • setAttacking

      public void setAttacking(boolean attacking)
      Sets the attacking state of the player.
      Parameters:
      attacking - true to set the player as attacking, false otherwise.

    • isLeft

      public boolean isLeft()
      Checks if the player is currently moving left.
      Returns:
      true if the player is moving left, false otherwise.

    • setLeft

      public void setLeft(boolean left)
      Sets the left movement state of the player.
      Parameters:
      left - true to set the player as moving left, false otherwise.

    • isRight

      public boolean isRight()
      Checks if the player is currently moving right.
      Returns:
      true if the player is moving right, false otherwise.

    • setRight

      public void setRight(boolean right)
      Sets the right movement state of the player.
      Parameters:
      right - true to set the player as moving right, false otherwise.

    • setJump

      public void setJump(boolean jump)
      Sets the jump state of the player.
      Parameters:
      jump - true to set the player as jumping, false otherwise.

    • resetAll

      public void resetAll()
      Resets all player attributes to their default values. This includes resetting movement flags, health, position, and state. Additionally, it checks if the player is initially in the air and updates the inAir flag accordingly.

    • getTileY

      public int getTileY()
      Retrieves the tile Y position of the player.
      Returns:
      The Y position of the player in terms of tiles.
